e:exam-instruction.p: This exam describes the MEX XML format.
For more information about using this format, see https://github.com/digabi/exam-engine
e:exam-instruction.div: Some of the features do not work in Abitti. They are documented in warning boxes like this.

e:question.e:question-instruction: Exam structure is described in XML. It can contain also (X)HTML elements.

div.div:
Exam <e:exam>
1 element
Root element of the exam. All other elements are its descendants.
Exam languages <e:languages>
1 element
Exam language <e:language>
1-n elements
Exam title <e:exam-title>
1 element
Exam introduction and instructions <e:exam-instruction>
1 element
Reference to exam introduction and instructions read from file <e:exam-instruction-ref>
1 element
Table of contents <e:table-of-contents>
1 element
Section <e:section>
1-n elements
Section groups questions
Section title <e:section-title>
1 element
Section title can contain HTML elements. Section number is added automatically.
Section instructions <e:section-instruction>
0-n elements
Section instructions can contain HTML elements.
Question <e:question>
0-n elements
Questions can contain sub- e:question s
Question title <e:question-title>
1 element
Question title can contain HTML elements. Question number is added automatically.
Question instructions <e:question-instruction>
0-1 elements
Question instructions can contain HTML elements.
External material <e:external-material>
0-1 elements
External material page is constructed based on e:external-material elements defined within all e:question elements. Therefore it is always clear what question external material is part of.
<e:external-material>
Contains e:attachment elements.
Internal material <e:attachment>
0-n elements
Internal material is displayed directly on exam page. Use e:external-material to display material on separate external material page.
Material title <e:attachment-title>
1 element
Audio material <e:audio>
0-1 elements
Image material <e:image>
0-1 elements
Video material <e:video>
0-1 elements
Material reference <e:reference>
1 element. See section Material below for details.
Answer type, e.g. <e:text-answer>
0-n elements
See section Answer types below for details.
OR
Sub-question <e:question>
0-n elements
Material references <e:references>
0-1 elements
Exam footer <e:exam-footer>
0-1 elements

tr.td: Exam code used for exam specific translations
Exam day code used for exam specific translations
CSS file with this name must exist in attachments directory
Maximum number of questions student should answer

e:question.p: exam-code and day-code attributes control exam-specific translations, e.g. the heading text of table of contents, and the exam title if specific e:exam-title element is missing. Currently supported exam and day code pairs can be found in https://github.com/digabi/exam-engine/blob/master/packages/mex/src/i18n/exam_titles_fi-FI.json.
e:question.div: max-answers is not supported in Abitti grading.

e:question.pre: <e:exam xmlns:e="http://ylioppilastutkinto.fi/exam.xsd" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xsi:schemaLocation="http://ylioppilastutkinto.fi/exam.xsd https://abitti.dev/schema/exam.xsd" exam-schema-version="0.1" date="2018-09-29" exam-code="EA" exam-stylesheet="custom.css">

e:question-instruction.p: Content for multiple language versions of the same exam can be defined using localization elements.
e:question-instruction.div: Only 1 language can be defined in Abitti exams.

e:question.pre:
fi-FI sv-FI ...

Älä jätä mitään merkintöjä sellaisen tehtävän vastaukselle varattuun tilaan, jota et halua jättää arvosteltavaksi.

Lämna inga anteckningar i svarsfältet för sådana uppgifter som du inte vill lämna in för bedömning.
e:question.p: Lämna inga anteckningar i svarsfältet för sådana uppgifter som du inte vill lämna in för bedömning.

e:section-instruction.p: Exam consists of sections. Each section is described in e:section element.
Section can define how many questions should be answered using max-answers attribute.
e:section-instruction.div: max-answers is not supported in Abitti grading.
e:section-instruction.p: CAS applications can be disabled for a section by setting cas-forbidden="true" attribute.

e:section-instruction.pre: <e:section max-answers="1"> <e:section-title>Example section title</e:section-title> <e:section-instruction>Section instructions</e:section-instruction> ...HTML code, questions... <e:question> <e:question-title>Example question title</e:question-title> <e:question-instruction>Question instructions</e:question-instruction> …HTML code, answer types, materials, sub-questions... </e:question> </e:section>

e:section.e:question: Example question titleQuestion instructions …HTML code, answer types, materials, sub-questions...

e:section-instruction.p: Every section consists of questions defined using e:question elements. Questions are numbered automatically and they can contain HTML code, answer types, material or sub-questions. Question can define how many sub-questions should be answered using max-answers attribute.
Maximum score of question is calculated automatically using the answer types, optional sub-questions and the limits from max-answers attributes.
e:section-instruction.div: max-answers is not supported in Abitti grading.

e:section-instruction.pre: <e:question> <e:question-title>Example question title</e:question-title> <e:question-instruction>Question description</e:question-instruction> …HTML code, answer types, materials, sub-questions... </e:question>

e:section.e:question: Example question titleQuestion description …HTML code, answer types, materials, sub-questions...

e:section-instruction.pre: <e:question max-answers="1"> <e:question-title>Second example question title</e:question-title> <e:question-instruction>Second example question instructions</e:question-instruction> <e:question> <e:question-title>First sub-question title</e:question-title> <e:question-instruction>First sub-question instructions</e:question-instruction> …HTML code, answer types, materials, sub-questions... </e:question> <e:question> <e:question-title>Second sub-question title</e:question-title> <e:question-instruction>Second sub-question instructions</e:question-instruction> …HTML code, answer types, materials, sub-questions... </e:question> </e:question>

e:question.e:question: First sub-question titleFirst sub-question instructions …HTML code, answer types, materials, sub-questions...
Second sub-question titleSecond sub-question instructions …HTML code, answer types, materials, sub-questions...

e:question.p: There are two types of text answers. rich-text answer is intended for verbose essay-style answers, whereas single-line answer is intended for short, at most couple words, answers.
Examinee can also attach screenshots to rich-text answers.

tr.td: Maximum number of screenshots allowed (only for rich-text type answer)

e:question.h4: rich-text answer example with screenshot limit

e:question-instruction.p: e:choice-answer answer type creates a group of option buttons. Answer options are defined within it using e:choice-answer-option elements.
e:question-instruction.div: Choice answers are not supported in Abitti

e:question.p: Options can contain any HTML code, like images or formulas
Horizontal direction works well for images
e:question.pre: <e:choice-answer direction="horizontal"> <e:choice-answer-option> <e:image src="example_small.jpg" /> </e:choice-answer-option> <e:choice-answer-option> <e:image src="example.jpg" /> </e:choice-answer-option> <e:choice-answer-option> <e:image src="example.jpg" /> </e:choice-answer-option> <e:choice-answer-option> <e:image src="example_high.jpg" /> </e:choice-answer-option> <e:choice-answer-option> <e:image src="example.jpg" /> </e:choice-answer-option> </e:choice-answer>

e:question-instruction.p: e:dropdown-answer creates a dropdown menu. Similarly to e:choice-answer , answer options are defined within it using e:dropdown-anser-option elements.
e:question-instruction.div: Dropdown answers are not supported in Abitti

e:question-instruction.p: e:scored-text-answer is like e:text-answer , but it is graded automatically based on a set of correct answers. To display answer hints on the right side of the page, group e:scored-text-answer elements within a e:scored-text-answers element.
e:question-instruction.div: scored-text-answer grading must be done manually in Abitti.

e:question.pre: <e:scored-text-answers> Lorem ipsum, <e:scored-text-answer> <e:hint>dolor?</e:hint> <e:accepted-answer score="1">dolor</e:accepted-answer> </e:scored-text-answer> dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing <e:scored-text-answer> <e:hint>elit?</e:hint> <e:accepted-answer score="1">elit</e:accepted-answer> </e:scored-text-answer> . Aliquam, explicabo. Ut, <e:scored-text-answer> <e:hint>vero?</e:hint> <e:accepted-answer score="1">vero</e:accepted-answer> </e:scored-text-answer> ? Exercitationem eos unde possimus <e:scored-text-answer> <e:hint>laboriosam?</e:hint> <e:accepted-answer score="1">laboriosam</e:accepted-answer> </e:scored-text-answer> , consectetur cum perspiciatis aut <e:scored-text-answer> <e:hint>dolores?</e:hint> <e:accepted-answer score="1">dolores</e:accepted-answer> </e:scored-text-answer> quas autem eaque impedit dolore. Blanditiis, eos doloribus. </e:scored-text-answers>

div.e:scored-text-answers: Lorem ipsum, dolor? dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit? . Aliquam, explicabo. Ut, vero? ? Exercitationem eos unde possimus laboriosam? , consectetur cum perspiciatis aut dolores? quas autem eaque impedit dolore. Blanditiis, eos doloribus.

e:question.p: e:scored-text-answer can also be used without hints, e.g. in mathematics exams.

e:question-instruction.p: Questions can contain material like images, videos, HTML or files opened in external application. Reference data can be defined within the e:attachment by using e:reference element. Reference information is displayed by adding e:references element, usually at the end of the exam.
If material should be displayed on an external material page, the e:attachment element can be defined as child of an e:external-material element.

tr.td: Name of the material. Used only when material is linked to from e:attachment-link or e:attachment-links element.
Exam language code. Use when material should be included only in certain language version.
Reference to the original source, e.g. "Youtube service"

e:question.pre:
Title

...HTML code...

...More HTML code...

Dolor Tempor Qui ullamco non ut proident sit incididunt adipisicing Culpa ex MEB web service Internet service https://www.ylioppilastutkinto.fi/en/matriculation-examination 1983-05-09 2019-04-01 Travis Translator Mary Modifier Free text field

e:reference.e:author: Dolor Tempor
e:reference.e:title: Qui ullamco non ut proident sit incididunt adipisicing

e:question.pre:
Title 1

...HTML code...

...More HTML code...

Matriculation examination board Title 2 Dolor Tempor Qui ullamco non ut proident sit incididunt adipisicing Culpa ex MEB web service Internet service https://www.ylioppilastutkinto.fi/en/matriculation-examination 1983-05-09 2019-04-01 Travis Translator Mary Modifier Free text field

e:reference.e:author: Dolor Tempor
e:reference.e:title: Qui ullamco non ut proident sit incididunt adipisicing

e:question.e:question-instruction: e:image element adds an image to the exam. It can be used anywhere where HTML is allowed.

tr.td: Exam language code. Use when image should be included only in certain language version.

e:question.e:question-instruction: e:audio element adds an audio to the exam. It can be used anywhere where HTML is allowed.

tr.td: Maximum number of times the audio can be played by the examinee
Exam language code. Use when audio should be included only in certain language version.

e:question.e:question-instruction: e:audio-group element can be used to group audio elements by adding a separator before the group.
e:question.pre: <e:audio-group> <e:audio src="example1.webm" times="2">The whole recording</e:audio> </e:audio-group> <e:audio-group> <e:question> <e:question-title>Kuuntelumonivalinta</e:question-title> <e:choice-answer> <e:choice-answer-option score="2">Lorem</e:choice-answer-option> <e:choice-answer-option score="0">Ipsum</e:choice-answer-option> <e:choice-answer-option>Dolor</e:choice-answer-option> <e:choice-answer-option score="-1">Sit</e:choice-answer-option> </e:choice-answer> </e:question> <e:question> <e:question-title>Kuuntelumonivalinta</e:question-title> <e:choice-answer> <e:choice-answer-option score="2">Lorem</e:choice-answer-option> <e:choice-answer-option score="0">Ipsum</e:choice-answer-option> <e:choice-answer-option>Dolor</e:choice-answer-option> <e:choice-answer-option score="-1">Sit</e:choice-answer-option> </e:choice-answer> </e:question> <e:audio src="example2.webm" times="2">The passage related to questions 11.1. and 11.2.</e:audio> </e:audio-group> <e:audio-group> <e:question> <e:question-title>Kuuntelumonivalinta</e:question-title> <e:choice-answer> <e:choice-answer-option score="2">Lorem</e:choice-answer-option> <e:choice-answer-option score="0">Ipsum</e:choice-answer-option> <e:choice-answer-option>Dolor</e:choice-answer-option> <e:choice-answer-option score="-1">Sit</e:choice-answer-option> </e:choice-answer> </e:question> <e:audio src="example3.webm" times="2">The passage related to question 11.3.</e:audio> </e:audio-group>

e:audio-group.e:audio: The passage related to the two sub-questions immediately above.
The passage related to the sub-question immediately above.

e:question.e:question-instruction: e:video element adds an video to the exam. It can be used anywhere where HTML is allowed.

tr.td: Exam language code. Use when video should be included only in certain language version.

e:question.e:question-instruction: e:file element adds an external file to the exam. It can be used anywhere where HTML is allowed.

tr.td: Exam language code. Use when file should be included only in certain language version.

e:question.e:question-instruction: Material on external material page can be linked to from exam page by using e:attachment-link element.

tr.td: Value of the linked e:attachment 's name attribute.
Type of the reference, see example below.

e:question.div:
long type reference:
short type reference:

e:question.e:question-instruction: Use e:attachment-links element to refere to multiple materials.

e:question-instruction.p: You can add \LaTeX formulas by using e:formula element. Formulas can be placed both within text ( inline ) and on their own line ( display ).

e:formula.mml: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" alttext="\int_0^\infty e^{-x^2} dx=\frac{\sqrt{\pi}}{2}"> <msubsup> <mo>∫<!-- ∫ --></mo> <mn>0</mn> <mi mathvariant="normal">∞<!-- ∞ --></mi> </msubsup> <msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD"> <mo>−<!-- − --></mo> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </msup> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <msqrt> <mi>π<!-- π --></mi> </msqrt> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> </math>

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block" alttext="\int_0^\infty e^{-x^2} dx=\frac{\sqrt{\pi}}{2}"> <msubsup> <mo>∫<!-- ∫ --></mo> <mn>0</mn> <mi mathvariant="normal">∞<!-- ∞ --></mi> </msubsup> <msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD"> <mo>−<!-- − --></mo> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </msup> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <msqrt> <mi>π<!-- π --></mi> </msqrt> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> </math>

e:question.p: All common header levels are in use.
e:question.pre:
h1. Title (40px, light)

h2. Title (30px, normal)

h3. Title (21px, semibold)

h4. Title (18px, semibold)

h5. Title (16px, semibold)
h6. Title (16px, semibold)
e:question.p: Text size can be modified using e-font-size-* classes.
e:question.pre:
.e-font-size-xxxl: (40px)

.e-font-size-xxl: (30px)

.e-font-size-xl: (21px)

.e-font-size-l: (18px)

.e-font-size-m: (16px, tekstin oletuskoko)

.e-font-size-s: (14px)

.e-font-size-xs: (12px)
e:question.p: Typeface can be modified using e-semibold , e-light , e-italic , and e-normal classes.
e:question.pre:
.e-semibold: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet

.e-light: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet

.e-italic: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet

.e-normal: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet

.e-underline: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet
e:question.p: Text can be positioned both horizontally and vertically by using e-text-* classes.
Short quotes can be defined using blockquote element.
e:question.pre:
Consectetur quis ad fugiat ad. Do consequat sunt sit non commodo. Fugiat laborum Lorem sint laboris cupidatat ipsum eiusmod. Incididunt exercitation nostrud duis nulla deserunt consectetur aliquip aliquip cupidatat. In reprehenderit aliquip velit anim pariatur. Lorem cillum irure cupidatat veniam non incididunt enim commodo. Cillum pariatur tempor excepteur laboris tempor exercitation consequat laboris adipisicing duis proident proident amet.

—https://www.ylioppilastutkinto.fi

e:question.p: Contents can also be highlighted using e-box class.

e:question.e:question-instruction: For images aligned to the right there is a helper class e-illustration-right . In addition to right alignment, it adds proper margins. The class does not restrict image size, therefore e-width-* classes can be used simultaneously.

e:question-instruction.p: For setting margin and padding there are own helper classes. The size set using numbers, e.g. in e-pad-8 the padding is 8 times larger than in e-pad-1 .

tr.td: Padding to the left and right
Padding to the top and bottom
Margin to the left and right
Margin to the top and bottom

e:question.pre:
e-pad-1 e-pad-2 e-pad-4 e-pad-8
e-pad-l-1 e-pad-l-2 e-pad-l-4 e-pad-l-8
e-pad-r-1 e-pad-r-2 e-pad-r-4 e-pad-r-8
e-pad-x-1 e-pad-x-2 e-pad-x-4 e-pad-x-8
e-pad-y-1 e-pad-y-2 e-pad-y-4 e-pad-y-8

e:question.e:question-instruction: Use classes e-table , e-table--borderless , and e-table--zebra .

Table title
First column Second column Third column

e:question.p: Cells can be formatted using e.g. e-pad-* or e-text-* classes.
e:question.pre:
Table title
First column (padding to the left) Second column (centered) Third column (aligned to the right)
Lorem Ipsum Dolor
e:question.p: If a table is very wide, you can prevent it from overflowing and make it scrollable by wrapping it in an .e-scrollable-x element.

e:question-instruction.p:
Text columns can be added using e-columns class. Ever child element within it must have
e-column class
There is some empty space between columns.

e:question.p: By default columns have equal width
You can also use a 12 column system
e:question.pre:
e-column--6
e-column--3
e-column--3
e-column--8
e-column--2
e-column--2
e-column--2
e-column--8
e-column--2
e:question.p: To make column as narrow as possible, use e-column--narrow class.

e:exam-footer.p: For more information about using this format, see https://github.com/digabi/exam-engine
